intro: Chamaesyce pinetorum, commonly known as the pine woods sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It typically thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in pine forests or open woodlands. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, usually blooming in the spring. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in dry conditions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural and ecological traits.
